intro: Ptarmica cartilaginea, commonly known as the cartilaginous tormentil, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are covered in a distinctive, waxy coating. Ptarmica cartilaginea thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
